var cwd = process.cwd(),
    fs = require('fs'),
    exec = require('child_process').exec;
 
/**
 * Outputs a styled message to the console.
 *
 * @param {String} msg
 * @param {String} type (optional)
 * @api public
 */
var status = function (msg, type) {
    var cmd = type;
    
    switch (type) {
    case 'info':
        msg = '\x1B[33mINFO\x1B[0m: ' + msg;
        break;
 
    case 'debug':
        cmd  = 'info';
        msg = '\x1B[36mDEBUG\x1B[0m: ' + msg;
        break;
 
    case 'error':
    case 'fatal':
        cmd  = 'error';
        msg = '\x1B[31mERROR\x1B[0m: ' + msg;
        break;
 
    case 'ok':
        cmd  = 'info';
        msg = '\x1B[32mOK\x1B[0m: ' + msg;
        break;
 
    case 'bold':
        cmd  = 'info';
        msg = '\x1B[33mINFO\x1B[0m: \x1B[1m' + msg + '\x1B[0m';
        break;
    }
    
    console[cmd](msg); //Write output according to status severity
    if (type === 'fatal') {
        process.exit(1);
    }
};
exports.status = {};
['info', 'error', 'fatal', 'ok', 'debug', 'bold'].forEach(function (type) {
    exports.status[type] = function (msg) {
        status(msg, type);
    };
});
 
/**
 * Removes the specified file on exit.
 *
 * @param {String} file
 * @api public
 */
exports.removeOnExit = function (file) {
    var removeFile = function () {
        try {
            fs.unlinkSync(file);
        } catch (e) {}
        try {
            process.exit();
        } catch (e) {}
    };
    ['SIGINT', 'SIGTERM', 'SIGQUIT', 'SIGHUP', 'exit'].forEach(function (signal) {
        process.on(signal, removeFile);
    });
};
 
/**
 * Compiles a CoffeeScript file (.coffee) using coffee(1).
 *
 * @param {String} coffee_file
 * @param {String} compiled_file
 * @param {Function} callback
 * @api public
 */
exports.compile = function (compiler, coffee_file, compiled_file, callback) {
    exec(compiler + ' -p -c "' + coffee_file + '"', {cwd: cwd}, function (err, stdout, stderr) {
        if (err || stderr) {
            callback(err || stderr);
        } else {
            exports.removeOnExit(compiled_file);
            fs.writeFile(compiled_file, stdout, callback);
        }
    });
};

exports.crc32 = function (str, hex) {
    var crc = ~0, i;
    for (i = 0; i < str.length; i++) {
        crc = (crc >>> 8) ^ crc32tab[(crc ^ str.charCodeAt(i)) & 0xff];
    }
    crc = crc ^ (-1);
    return hex ? crc.toString(16) : crc;
};
 
/**
 * Takes an arbitrary number of arguments (objects) and copies
 * ALL properties from right to left.
 *
 * @param {Object(s)} ...
 * @return {Object}
 * @api public
 */
 var x = 0;
exports.put = function (o /*, args */) {
    //Create o={} if not an object
    Iif (typeof o !== 'object') o = {};
 
    var obj = Array.prototype.slice.call(arguments,1),
        i = 0, l = obj.length;
 
    //Iterate over each subsequent object and copy properties into o
    for (; i < l; i++) {
        for (var j in obj[i]) {
            Eif (obj[i].hasOwnProperty(j)) {
                o[j] = obj[i][j];
            }
        }
    }
 
    return o;
}
 
/**
 * Takes an arbitrary number of arguments (objects) and copies
 * properties from right to left only if they don't already exist.
 *
 * @param {Object(s)} ...
 * @return {Object}
 * @api public
 */
exports.put_default = function (o /*, args */) {
    //Create o={} if not an object
    if (typeof o !== 'object') o = {};
 
    var obj = Array.prototype.slice.call(arguments,1),
        i = 0, l = obj.length;
 
    //Iterate over each subsequent object and copy properties into o
    //if they don't already exist
    for (; i < l; i++) {
        for (var j in obj[i]) {
            if (typeof o[j] === 'undefined' && obj[i].hasOwnProperty(j)) {
                o[j] = obj[i][j];
            }
        }
    }
 
    return o;
}
 
/**
 * Custom stringify function.
 *
 * @param {Object} data
 * @param {String} newline (optional)
 * @param {Boolean} stringify_array
 * @return {String}
 * @api public
 */
exports.dataToString = function (data, newline, stringify_array) {
    var str = '';
    newline = newline || '\n';
    if (!stringify_array && data instanceof Array) {
        for (var i = 0, l = data.length; i < l; i++) {
            str += exports.dataToString(data[i], newline, true);
        }
    } else if (typeof data === 'object') {
        str = JSON.stringify(data) + newline;
    } else {
        str = data + newline;
    }
    return str;
};
 
/**
 * A method for creating and controlling a node.io daemon.
 *
 * `arg` can be:
 *      start = daemonizes the process
 *      stop  = stops the daemon if it is running
 *      restart = alias for stop -> start
 *      pid = outputs the daemon's PID if it is running
 *      log = outputs the daemon's log file (stdout & stderr)
 *
 * @param {String} arg
 * @param {Function} callback
 * @api public
 */
exports.daemonize = function (arg, callback) {
    var lock_file = '/tmp/nodeio.pid',
        log_file = '/tmp/nodeio.log';
 
    try {
        var daemon = require('daemon');
    } catch(e) {
        exports.status.fatal('Please run `npm install daemon`');
    }
 
    var start = function () {
        daemon.daemonize(log_file, lock_file, function (err) {
            if (err) return status('Error starting daemon: ' + err, 'error');
            callback();
        });
    };
 
    var stop = function () {
        try {
            fs.readFileSync(lock_file);
        } catch (e) {
            return status('Daemon is not running', 'error');
        };
        daemon.kill(lock_file, function (err, pid) {
            if (err && err.errno === 3) {
                return status('Daemon is not running', 'error');
            } else if (err) {
                return status('Error stopping daemon: ' + err.errno, 'error');
            }
            status('Successfully stopped daemon with pid: ' + pid, 'ok');
        });
    };
 
    switch(arg) {
    case 'stop':
        stop();
        break;
    case 'restart':
        daemon.kill(lock_file, function () {
            start();
        });
        break;
    case 'log':
        try {
            console.log(fs.readFileSync(log_file, 'utf8'));
        } catch (e) {
            return status('No daemon log file', 'error');
        };
        break;
    case 'pid':
        try {
            var pid = fs.readFileSync(lock_file, 'utf8');
            fs.statSync('/proc/' + pid);
            status(pid, 'info');
        } catch (e) {
            return status('Daemon is not running', 'error');
        };
        break;
    default:
        start();
        break;
    }
}
 
/**
 * Recursively find all files in a directory (async).
 *
 * `callback` receives an array of files.
 *
 * @param {String} path
 * @param {Function} callback
 * @api public
 */
exports.getFiles = function (root_path, callback) {
    var files = [];
    fs.readdir(root_path, function(err, dir_files) {
        if (err) throw err;
        var i = dir_files.length;
        var check_complete = function () {
            if (i === 0) {
                callback(files);
            }
        };
        check_complete();
        dir_files.forEach(function (path) {
            fs.stat(root_path + '/' + path, function (err, stat) {
                if (err) throw err;
                if (stat.isDirectory()) {
                    exports.getFiles(root_path + '/' + path, function (subdir_files) {
                        subdir_files.forEach(function (file) {
                            files.push(path + '/' + file);
                        });
                        i--;
                        check_complete();
                    });
                } else {
                    files.push(path);
                    i--;
                    check_complete();
                }
            });
        });
    });
};
 
exports.tick = typeof setImmediate !== 'undefined' ? setImmediate : process.nextTick;
